channel.title: Qt wallet says synchronizing with network but stuck at 3 years 36 weeks behind
channel.description:
My system has the following specifications: - QT Wallet 2.0.0.1 - Windows 10 - I'm not sure how to find block # of your client and # of connections
My qt wallet says synchronizing with network but stuck at 3 years 36 weeks behind. Can you please help me!
Thank you! :)

item.title: Qt wallet says synchronizing with network but stuck at 3 years 36 weeks behind
item.dc:creator: @truetrue sim
item.description:
@truetrue wrote:

Thanks!
I also just saw a post about a hard fork. I haven’t gone near my BitBay in nearly two years. Does this mean I’ve lost my Bay?

Read full topic
item.source: Qt wallet says synchronizing with network but stuck at 3 years 36 weeks behind

item.title: Qt wallet says synchronizing with network but stuck at 3 years 36 weeks behind
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Hi,

Thanks for reaching out for support. It looks like you are running an old version of the QT Wallet, which is likely on the wrong chain. The latest version is 3.0.2b. Please follow these directions to update your wallet and get back on the correct chain:

How to fix the chain split issue on Qt wallet (**MANDATORY FOR USERS**) Support
Please complete the following steps to download and install the new bootstrap and QT wallet. It is necessary to follow the steps in the correct order. Back up your “wallet.dat” and “BitBay” folder before moving to step two. Depending on your operating system, the BitBay data folder can be found in these locations: Windows users: users/“yourusername”/appdata/roaming/Bitbay folder (make sure you have “show hidden files” selected) Mac users: ~/Library > Application Support > BitBay Linux…

If you have any questions, let us know!

Read full topic
item.source: Qt wallet says synchronizing with network but stuck at 3 years 36 weeks behind
